intro: Psychotria rubristipulata, commonly known as the red-stippled psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on the leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria rubristipulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments.
